channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Satellites keep photobombing the Hubble telescope, and it’s getting worse
item.description: It’s getting harder and harder for the Hubble and other telescopes orbiting Earth to capture pristine images thanks to the sudden surge in satellite launches. Satellite trails could mess up nearly 40 percent of images the Hubble takes and up to 96 percent of those taken by three other telescopes over the next decade, according […]

item.title: This Microbe ‘Plays Dead’ in NASA Clean Rooms, and We May Have Sent It to Mars
item.description: 18 years ago, a sneaky bacteria infiltrated some of the cleanest places on Earth. Scientists finally know how.

item.title: Andy Jassy says Amazon’s Nvidia competitor chip is already a multibillion-dollar business
item.description: Can any company, big or small, really topple Nvidia's AI chip dominance? Maybe not entirely, but Amazon is already making big bucks trying.

item.title: The Age-Gated Internet Is Sweeping the US. Activists Are Fighting Back
item.description: Half of the country now requires age verification to watch porn or access “harmful” content. Digital rights advocates are pushing back against legislation they say will make the internet less safe.

item.title: Bryan Fuller Reveals the Inspirations for His Dark Fairytale Feature Debut
item.description: 'Dust Bunny' reunites Fuller with 'Hannibal' star Mads Mikkelsen and hits theaters December 12.

item.title: Anthropic’s AI bubble ‘YOLO’ warning
item.description: This is an excerpt of Sources by Alex Heath, a newsletter about AI and the tech industry, syndicated just for The Verge subscribers once a week. Dario Amodei took the stage at the DealBook Summit on Wednesday to throw punches without naming names. The Anthropic CEO spent a good chunk of the interview with Andrew […]

item.title: I tested 30 smart locks, and these are the best
item.description: A smart lock is an easy solution to some common problems. Locked yourself out? Need to let a friend in to water the plants? Your latchkey kid lost their key? Hands are full, and it’s raining cats and dogs? A smart lock solves all of these problems and more. One of the best smart home […]

item.title: The Galaxy S25 FE has all the looks of the Galaxy S25 Plus, but none of the snap
item.description: The Galaxy S25 FE is a solid phone that struggles to stand out as the Galaxy S25 Plus and other rivals offer a better experience.

item.title: That's what I call a dip - world's largest derivatives exchange shut down by embarrassing data center cooling issue
item.description: CME halted global trading due to a cooling failure at its data center, revealing risks in automated systems and high-value transactions.

item.title: Trumps Scores Big Win for Gas Guzzlers, but Not All Auto Giants Are On Board
item.description: "Today, we're taking one more step to kill the 'Green New Scam,'" Trump said.

item.title: Reddit’s CEO says r/popular ‘sucks,’ and it’s going away
item.description: Reddit is “moving away” from r/popular, the default feed for new users, and plans to replace it with “better, more relevant and personalized feeds,” according to CEO Steve Huffman (aka Spez). Huffman also notes that r/popular “sucks.” “For a long while, we were known as the ‘front page of the internet,’ but we’ve outgrown a […]

item.title: Trump embraces gas guzzlers and air pollution by weakening fuel economy standards
item.description: President Donald Trump announced a new plan that lets carmakers pollute more by making less fuel efficient vehicles. The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said today that it’ll roll back fuel economy rules finalized last year by the Biden administration for model year 2022-2031 vehicles. The Trump administration has eliminated incentives for EV purchases, […]...

item.title: I tested the world’s first rollable laptop - and the Lenovo ThinkBook Plus Gen 6 Rollable's extendable display changed my understanding of what working on the go really means
item.description: The Lenovo ThinkBook Plus Gen 6 Rollable is a laptop from the future.

item.title: Our brains peak in our early 30s, research says
item.description: Our brain undergoes four key turning points in life, a new study shows. New research now suggests that our brains are still in the teenage phase until we “peak” in our early thirties.

item.title: ‘Paranormal Activity’ Just Won’t Stop Coming Back
item.description: James Wan adds to his horror empire by joining the next installment in the spooky found-footage series.

item.title: Uber’s Robotaxi Rolls Out in Dallas With Human Supervision
item.description: Uber will have its targets set on Waymo in 2026.

item.title: Trump administration rolls back fuel economy standards, again
item.description: The regulatory decision would make it harder for future administrations to implement stricter fuel efficiency standards.

item.title: La marque Crucial va disparaitre, les prix de la mémoire vont exploser (encore)
item.description: La chasse à la barrette de RAM pour muscler votre PC gaming va devenir un sport de plus en plus risqué. Un des géants du secteur de la mémoire, Micron, a en effet annoncé que sa marque grand public Curcial allait quitter le marché. L'entreprise veut se concentrer sur les grands comptes — comprenez : le secteur de l'IA.

item.title: WordPress’s vibe-coding experiment, Telex, has already been put to real-world use
item.description: Though WordPress's Telex is still an experiment, the vibe-coding software has already been used to help build real-world websites.

item.title: Senators Grill NASA Nominee Over Leaked Plan to Slash Science and Privatize Space
item.description: “I do stand behind everything in the document.”

item.title: The Guy Behind Liquid Glass Is Leaving Apple for Meta
item.description: Is everyone leaving Apple now?

item.title: Watch out - these scam Mac Store apps are impersonating Google Gemini & OpenAI ChatGPT
item.description: Scam apps impersonating Google Gemini and ChatGPT repeatedly appear on the Mac Store, exploiting branding and exposing users to potential security risks.
